title: Very Detailed
text: I must say, this app is not the easiest to understand and navigate for people with minimal knowledge of astrology. That being said this is an amazing app for learning it from the ground up. It has helped me understand how things relate to me on a much deeper level than prior to this apps use. Other apps tell you what their interpretations are for you, this app allows you to make your own interpretation based on what is known to be fact or very long-standing and upheld beliefs. And find out how these things apply to you both on a day to day level, and long term.

title: Vedic vs Tropical
text:
This app is my favorite because I like to learn both systems. I am not a professional astrologer but I am high interested in it because it is so applicable to life situations and can provide great healing resources. I love the idea of being able to bounce back and forth from Vedic to Tropical because I am curious about both systems. I see the benefit in both and like blending them for my own curiosity. I do have some suggestions but I will email them once I have a chance. I just have habit of jumping in deep then trying to swim my way back up but the depth of the information in this app approaches astrology and astronomy. It really helps me learn the deeper meanings and apply the information. Hopefully I am doing it right haha

title: Awesome iOS app w/ many free features
text: I am so grateful for Time Nomad. Denis, the creator is great, responds to emails, and really knows his astrology, as well as programming obviously! I could not afford to purchase SolarFire or the Mac one TimePassages. This app lets me create as many charts as I have wanted, and save them in my list. There are too many customizable features to list here. I love the time scrolling option to scoot forward or backwards in time, particularly when looking at the current chart of the moment. It‚Äôs great for looking where the planets and Moon will be for planning events into the future and choosing dates for vacations etc. I‚Äôve purchased add-ons, including Progressions and Fixed Stars, and am always happy to do so bc I know what a deal I‚Äôve got going here with an app I didn‚Äôt have to pay anything for to start using in the first place! I feel really blessed. And Denis‚Äô blog posts (available in feed icon in top right side menu) are so timely and enlightening, and add to my astro knowledge, especially about major current transits. Check out the one about Covid-19!!! This app allows me to ‚Äúdo astrology‚Äù on the go without a computer. It is packed with features you can find by exploring the app and with a little practice, these easily become familiar & indispensable. I wish Time Nomad was available for laptop/desktop, so I could print from it, not *just* for iPhone/iPad, but hey, the world isn‚Äôt perfect! Until I can buy one of those expensive ‚Äúprofessional‚Äù programs, this is my astro software and I love it.

title: Awesome App! Feedback for development
text:
I really love this app for calculating charts on the go and looking at future and past transits and all things lunar. I particularly like to use this app when I‚Äôm trying to place someone‚Äôs ascendant. This app also introduced me to the concept of fixed stars and some of the less well known asteroids.

It can be overwhelming for someone who is brand new to astrology, but the app is highly customizable, so you can control which features are at your fingertips. For example, you can change orb ranges, limit which aspects are available for viewing (so if you wanted to turn off minor aspects you could), etc. 

If you‚Äôre thinking about downloading - do it. It‚Äôs worth it even though I‚Äôm submitting feedback for developers. 

FEEDBACK FOR DEVELOPMENT:
- There‚Äôs a bug where the wrong forecasting date is shown at the top when looking at future or past transits to the natal chart, and sometimes when you‚Äôre viewing the natal chat +/- time
- I use this app to catalog charts so being able to group them or rearrange the order they appear on the left would be super helpful.
- Editing birth data or deleting a chart is not intuitive from a UX perspective since you have to click the add button (edit library > select person). A separate button would be great

title: Low contrast font w/tiny type = hard to see
text:
I‚Äôd give Time Nomad a higher score IF I could read it. Because of the low contrast font color and small size type, coupled with a screen that doesn‚Äôt enlarge, makes this Tome Nomad a non-visible app to my 58 year old eyes that use 1.25 magnifying reading glasses. Seems like if your going to use the type and color scheme you‚Äôve chosen you should make the screen enlargable, otherwise you are making Time Nomad useless for anyone without perfect eyesight. Looks like a good program but I can‚Äôt be sure because I just can‚Äôt see it.

To Gary - the developer - the solution to this problem is SIMPLE. Put all fonts in BLACK ink against a WHITE background.  That‚Äôs all you have to do - provide contrast so the letters can be seen.  

Even if the font size is small, IF the developer provides high-contrast letters (i.e., black letters on white background) then older eyes can read your app.  Otherwise, it‚Äôs not much use, if you can‚Äôt see it.

title: LOOK NO FURTHER--SIX STARS. Amazing app. (Follow-up Review)
text:
Look no further, get this app. If you are a serious astrology student, this is the app you need. 

This is a follow-up to my 1st review that Apple did not let me access. 

My 1st review had 3 stars, this is an upgrade. It isn't that something goes wrong that makes an app; something WILL go wrong--it is the nature of software. It is WHAT HAPPENS when it goes wrong that makes the app, and this developer is top shelf.

------------------------------------
Apple strikes again! 
App Store not able to recognize me while logged in; and hides new reviews miles down in the list. 

I wrote a review, downgraded the star rating after paid part of app broke; and wanted to upgrade it again. If I can ever find that review again I will edit it, Time Nomad deserves a SOLID five stars.
-----------------------------------

This app is epic. Serious, albeit beginning astrology student here. This app is better than many costing $30 and up! It does require an internet connection; but the bonus is that you get very precise coordinates, and the app takes up less space on your phone, and will run a lot faster as the bulk of the work takes place on the server.

It is fast, flawless, feature-packed and comes with a great help system which is activated by clicking on the various elements such as f. example transits. 

The paid progression broke; but--this gal is an old geek, been using computers since the -80's and let me tell you; personal service like this is exceptional, and in 2018, downright unheard of. The developer personally answered my query and spent time troubleshooting my issue via e-mail. Color me IMPRESSED! While the part still isn't functional; the rest of the app still is, and I am 100% convinced it will be taken care of. 

I have therefore scrapped my plans of buying another program, and instead plan on springing for the asteroid package to make it a complete solution. 

I'd give Time Nomad six stars if I could. 

Thank you Denis!! ‚ò∫Ô∏èüëç

text:
Time Nomad offers a unique approach to astrological data. A variety of graphical representations provide transit and relational information whether Natal or synastric or composite.
Slider controllers provide interactive input for temporal adjustment and transit or aspect rendering...
However, while it's all interesting, and clearly the design and features are worthy of some praise, the immediately obvious stumbling block is the lack of any way to export ones data...
